description: Multiple sample FTP user credentials, including plaintext passwords, were found in the stupid-ftpd configuration file. Although these are examples, they might be used in practice. The samples include: user1/passx, user2/passy, user3/passz, user4/passq. These weak passwords are vulnerable to brute-force attacks.
code_snippet:
user=user1 passx /tmp  2 D 
user=user2 passy /home/user2 0 DU
user=user3 passz /home/user3 5 DUOM
user=user4 passq /tmp 10 -

description: Anonymous FTP access is enabled and configured to allow a maximum of 5 concurrent anonymous logins. This could be exploited for unauthorized file access.

code_snippet:
Binary file ./etc_ro/ppp/plugins/cmd.so matches
Binary file ./etc_ro/ppp/plugins/sync-pppd.so matches
